title: 10. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Are Insects a Problem? (2 & 6 February 2012)

tasks.task: Assessing insect presence and impact on rice plants
subtasks: Confirming current stage of rice plant development
Identifying potential insect pests (e.g., whirled maggots, leaf folders)
Evaluating natural enemy presence and activity (e.g., parasitoid wasps, lady beetles, dragonflies)
Recognizing beneficial insects' role in controlling pest populations
Monitoring for signs of animal damage (e.g., rat infestation)

tasks.task: Evaluating natural ecosystem balance in a rice field
subtasks: Observing interactions between aquatic insects and mosquito control
Noting the role of spiders in predating plant hoppers
Considering human perception of insect presence and potential misapplication of pesticides

tasks.task: Addressing rat damage in agricultural fields
subtasks: Detecting and assessing damage caused by rodents
Considering preventive measures or recovery strategies for affected areas

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Inspect and monitor the rice field for pests and beneficial insects; report any signs of damage, particularly from rats.**
Inspect and monitor the rice field for pests and beneficial insects; report any signs of damage, particularly from rats.
Inspect and monitor the rice field for insects and beneficial organisms; report any signs of damage, particularly from rodents.
